alert.note: Alert for Butler; Covington; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 10:51AM CDT until April 05 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT FOR BUTLER...CENTRAL MONROE...CRENSHAW...CONECUH AND NORTHERN COVINGTON COUNTIES... At 1050 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Lowndes County Airport to 9 miles northeast of Georgiana to 3 miles north of Evergreen to 3 miles southwest of Excel, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Monroeville, Evergreen, Luverne, Frisco City, Peterman, Georgiana, Brantley, McKenzie, Excel, Red Level, Rutledge, Dozier, Repton, Gantt, Glenwood, Petrey, I65 And US 84 and Highland Home. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
